entry.title: UCC Begins Work on Welcome Center and Medical Careers Hub
entry.summary: Umpqua Community College has begun building a $21.5 million Welcome Center and Medical Careers Hub. Opening in early 2027, it will centralize student services and expand medical training, backed by an $8 million state match and support from local partners.

entry.title: UCC's $21.5M project aims to transform Douglas County healthcare
entry.summary: ROSEBURG, Ore. - Umpqua Community College (UCC) has begun construction on a new Welcome Center and Medical Careers Hub, which was kicked off on Friday with the demolition of the Del Blanchard Administration Building.

entry.title: Drain residents hold mermaid party upon request
entry.summary: DRAIN — Ame Beard said she spent months planning the mermaid party with a group of people in Drain, after she was approached with the idea at another themed party she had thrown.

entry.title: Sutherlin Blackberry Festival: Car show, mud volleyball, BMX racing and more all weekend
entry.summary: SUTHERLIN — Ramona Briggs brought her 1959 Chevy El Camino to the Sutherlin Blackberry Festival car show Saturday, displaying the red vintage vehicle in the grass in Sutherlin’s Central Park.

entry.title: ROSEBURG RECEIVES MOST MEASURABLE RAINFALL SINCE MAY
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 6:30 a.m. Roseburg received the most measurable rainfall on a day since May, on Saturday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the Roseburg Regional Airport measured 0.13 inches of rain. That was the biggest amount of rain since May 12th, when...

entry.title: SUPPRESSION EFFORTS CONTINUE ON HISTORIC DOERNER TREE FIRE
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 4:10 a.m. Firefighters from the Coos Forest Protective Association are actively engaged in suppression efforts on the Doerner Fir Tree fire. The historic tree, located east of Coquille on Bureau of Land Management land, was displaying active flames on the top and burning down a portion of the trunk. Multiple engines and...

entry.title: SCHOLFIELD FIRE REMAINS AT 50 ACRES NOW 43 PERCENT CONTAINED
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 4:00 a.m. Covering coastal Douglas County: The Scholfield Fire remains at 50 acres and is now 43 percent contained. An update from the Coos Forest Protective Association said the fire, located southeast of Reedsport, received measurable rain on Saturday. Sunday crews were able to regain access on the dirt roads and continued...

entry.title: SCENIC FIRE REMAINS AT 49 ACRES AND 80 PERCENT CONTAINED
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 3:50 a.m. The Scenic Fire on the High Cascades Ranger District remains at 49 acres and 80 percent contained. entry.title: HOYLE ANNOUNCES OVER $16.6 MILLION FOR 15 COMMUNITY PROJECTS
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 3:40 a.m. U.S. Representative Val Hoyle has announced that she recently secured $16.625 million in Community Project Funding from the federal government for projects across Oregon’s 4th district. A release said the funding, which would become available if Congress passes full-year appropriations bills, would be awarded in varying amounts to 15 towns,...

entry.title: SPECIAL TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT PATROLS THROUGH SEPTEMBER
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 3:30 a.m. For the remaining days of August, through the end of September, the Roseburg Police Department has some extra patrols out working traffic enforcement, with a specific focus on safety belt use, distracted driving, speeding, and driving under the influence. entry.title: ROSEBURG LIBRARY’S SUMMER READING PROGRAM
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 3:20 a.m. Roseburg Public Library’s Summer Reading Program is drawing to a close. entry.title: SMART READING SEEKS SITE COORDINATORS IN DOUGLAS COUNTY
entry.summary: August 18, 2025 3:05 a.m. SMART Reading, a statewide program that helps Oregon’s youngest readers build confidence and literary skills. is currently seeking site coordinators to help its work in Douglas County. Site coordinators lead the program at each school site, organizing volunteers, building relationships with school staff, putting together reading sessions, and helping ensure...

entry.title: HISTORIC DOERNER FIR TREE ON FIRE
entry.summary: August 17, 2025 3:20 a.m. The Doerner Fir, a large and historic coastal Douglas Fir tree, is burning on Bureau of Land Management land east of Coquille. A release issued Sunday afternoon from the BLM and the Coos Forest Protective Association said firefighters are on scene and working towards full suppression of the single-tree fire....

entry.title: Roseburg Police Department to increase patrols, traffic enforcement
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — The Roseburg Police Department will conduct extra traffic enforcement patrols with focus on seat belt use, distracted driving and driving under the influence.

entry.title: Roseburg burglar suspect entered home, cooked and ate food prior to arrest
entry.summary: A 33-year-old Roseburg man was arrested Thursday after allegedly entering a local residence where he spent several hours and cooked food for himself before he was eventually arrested, according to the Roseburg Police Department.

entry.title: BLM CLOSES SUSAN CREEK CAMPGROUND THROUGH TUESDAY
entry.summary: August 15, 2025 10:50 a.m. The Bureau of Land Management has closed Susan Creek Campground off Highway 138E, through next Tuesday. Public Affairs Specialist Greg Deimel said the closure was for health and safety precautions. Deimel said the campground is being deep cleaned and sanitized, but declined to go into detail

entry.title: Curtin Drug Bust Leads to Two Arrests, Multiple Seizures
entry.summary: Curtin drug bust nets 30 marijuana plants, meth, and firearms. Two men face charges, including manufacturing and possession. One suspect, a felon, was arrested for having guns. Six others were detained but released at the scene.
